arStrings.szText: Nnnot exactly. Well, not entirely, I guess? I don’t think I’ve ever just—explained it outside a rhyme. But, um, this time in the dark, guarding against the monsters? There’s so much fear.
slight emphasis on "entirely." He's struggling to get started here with his explanation.
So, people gather. In light, in celebration, in memory of the dead. The square is decorated not only with the effigies of monsters, but heirlooms of the lost.
He's rising in confidence as he goes on.
That warmth and unity isn’t because we aren’t afraid. It’s because when we’re afraid, we need each other most.
Fully immersed in the story he's telling now. His anxiety has been replaced with heart.
